article.Heading: Video: What Hyundai wants from Union Budget
article.Summary: Korean carmaker Hyundai raced ahead of competition in 2015, growing at a rate of 15 percent and now the company is focusing on consolidating its volumes. The company is trying to achieve the milestone of half million annual sales and a growth target of 6-7 percent in 2016.
article.Body:
Korean carmaker Hyundai raced ahead of competition in 2015, growing at a rate of 15 percent and now the company is focusing on consolidating its volumes. The company is trying to achieve the milestone of half million annual sales and a growth target of 6-7 percent in 2016.

What are the incentives the company is hoping for in the Budget? CNBC-TV18's Jude Sannith caught up with BC Datta, Assistant Vice President - Corporate Affairs, Hyundai Motor India.

Please watch video for the full discussion.
